title: Why are different coding languages used for different things? - Quora

response.answer_text: The same reason hammers and screwdrivers are used for different tasks. You could use either tool for committing acts of violence, just as you can use programming languages completely wrongly. Would you write a video library management system in z80 machine code (not even assembly!)? I know someone who did. Programming languages are suited towards writing software to solve specific types of problems. I wouldn’t write a database server in BASIC, or an arcade game in FORTRAN. Just as I have never unscrewed a screw with a hammer.
